content: Just wanted to point out that the Roc for Elm programmers doc is really well written. While it contains a lot of information, I kept on reading and found it surprisingly enjoyable and insightful!
Also I was shocked to read that there is no Maybe at first, but I think it's actually a good idea to not have it.
Maybe and result types in general are extremely easy to make with tag unions.
And Nix is a life saver. Really did work as advertised.
Such a breath of fresh air to have something understood and running in an evening without too many hickups. (I ended up nuking and reinstalling upgrading my WSL to version 2.)
